website_summaries.verdict: Get three appliances in one: toaster, convection oven, and airfryer.
pros: This 1800 watt oven has seven functions from airfrying to toasting
Get more space on countertops but still have all the functions in this one oven
Use it daily for all your needs from making pizzas to airfrying chicken wings in a flash
Uses little to no oil, with no deep frying required
Perfect for hot air fries, fish and chips, and chicken tenders
Comes with baking pan, airfryer basket/rack, and oven rack
cons: wash interior and pans prior to first use
Pans and tray are not dishwasher safe
Oven tends to run very hot

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend the wine and the fryer
customer_reviews.text: I never leave reviews. I'm been a huge proponent of the convection toaster oven for a long time but just got my first air fryer. Game changer. Just had my first air fried meal, and it was unbelievably crispy and very quickly cooked. I'm 23/25th through a bottle of wine right now, but I can assure you, the crsipiness was in fact the jam everyone here says it is. It is smaller than the dimensions listed, which is a plus. Highly recommend the wine and the fryer! #godblessautocorrect
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Knobs break easy ..... made of plastic
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this oven at the end of January 2018.... now just over 1 month the oven timer knob (which is plastic) has broken. This is the knob you use all the time to turn the oven on/off. I'm having no luck in finding a replacement knob.... Ok, it now two weeks later and I am changing my rating to one star ..... today on the same knob the timer no longer works. Oven just stays on indefinitely.... I thought I would love this oven and it is great looking but I am really worried that it's defects may start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Does not control temperature
customer_reviews.text: It does not matter what cook setting or what temperature you set it, it only goes very hot and burns everything. It’s off by over 100 degrees. Very poor quality from cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Seth B. Brickman

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: This thing burns everything. The bake setting still has the convection working on very low. Cant stop it from running. Pizza burns in 10 min. Air fryer burns the fries. The oven heat control temp. setting is way off as much as 50 degrees. Looks great but is useless. My $30 toaster oven that I had worked 100% better. Save your money and steer clear of the over priced oven. The so called non stick pan it comes with is not! Cant even clean it from the burnt food deposits on it. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Lou in Philly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: on/off knob broke (cheap plastic) contacted cuisinart they do not sell the knobs.... how crazy is that !! They will replace the whole unit.... Someone at Cuisinart needs to review this procedure ! (not cost effective) much cheaper to replace one plastic knob than the whole oven...
customer_reviews.author: Barkoff99

customer_reviews.title: Stick with simple model
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase and waste of money. Went in dumpster tonight. I had a basic toaster oven for 10 years but thought I needed a new one. This one smoked up my apt and needed to be thoroughly cleaned after each use. If I didn’t clean it the kitchen smelled. And even using tin foil on pan, the pan turned black after a couple of uses. When I moved it to clean on outside there were oil drippings on counter. I should get my money back on this one! This was throwing money out the window. I went to Target and bought a basic model.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions carefully before use!
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this product, I read all the reviews. Based on that, I bought it and read the instructions carefully because it seems to me that the people with the bad reviews did not read them. Product arrived in perfect condition, and works great, as advertised. I love this oven! I have not found anything that I can complain about after using it daily since we've had it.
customer_reviews.author: fineleather

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t purchase this product
customer_reviews.text: This product had great usage for the first 4 months they all of a sudden it stopped working just like the video another Amazon shoppers posted the timer works but they oven/fryer doesn’t work unless I open the oven/fryer door. The oven/fryer is very large but it does have a lot of features, I buy a lot of cusinart products and this is the first that failed me so quickly hopefully the customer service will make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Temperature
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a terrible time. I have cooked three times, three different things, three different time and temperature settings. Each time the food was burned on the outside and cool (or warm) on the inside. I cannot cook for the required time at any temperature. A cook time of 30 min. at 350 degree was burning at ten minutes time. Similar results for other attempts such as baked potatoes and pancakes. Burnt!! I believe the temperature is off by a considerable amount and I'm buying an oven thermometer to check it out.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Buckner

customer_reviews.title: The Thing for Wings!
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve just made wings but they are perfection! Crispy all over and so good! I have only needed about 1/2 cup oil to do about 10 pounds of wings, too.
customer_reviews.author: The Author

customer_reviews.title: Everything I've cooked in here is burnt on the outside ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything I've cooked in here is burnt on the outside and frozen in the center. I've played with the different settings, times and temperatures and still have the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Virgie A.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth about buying this because of the reviews. I am so glad I bought it. The air fry portion is wonderful to have. Times listed for items seem pretty accurate. I don't just set the timer and walk away tho. Sometimes it needs adjustment. Nothing has burned or not worked yet. Having all the functions right there in one appliance is super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not a good investment!
customer_reviews.text: The oven gets very hot and all the knobs are plastic. Mine has melted and now can turn the power on because the knob us no longer on the toaster oven. Tried to get replacement and the manufacturer doesn't want to help.
customer_reviews.author: ZENOBIA GRAHAM

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster and air fryer functions
customer_reviews.text: I had an old toaster oven that needed replacing and got this because of the additional air fryer function, and I love it! The toast function turns out the best bagels I’ve had and I’ve had so much fun making my own tortilla chips with the air fryer function. I’m still playing around with different things to use it with but so far everything has come out great! The only thing I don’t like about this is that there is no way to stop or reset the timer other than to open the door (which does stop the heating elements) and let it run itself out.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: It says right on the box "extra large capacity". ...
customer_reviews.text: It says right on the box "extra large capacity". It is not. I could not believe how small it was inside. Once I put the tray in there, I am not sure I could fix anything more than a grilled cheese sandwich in it.9878
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McLane

customer_reviews.title: Multi use and cooks fast and efficiently.
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to say how much I love this machine! I use the air fryer the most and am able to cook things without a microwave on little to no time. I would recommend cutting all cooking time for the air fryer in half. I just made bacon in the air fryer and it was done in 5 minutes and an easy clean up. Thank you for making life a little easier for this working mom of two babies and a deployed husband. Some cooking time suggesting on air fry: Bacon - 5 minutes Chicken nuggets - 4 minutes French fries - 5 minutes Tater tots - 7 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Rena

customer_reviews.title: Careful, it might melt your kitchen down
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, I knew I was getting more than the usual toaster oven. I was excited to set it up. Unpacked it, read the instructions, plugged it in, used the toaster. Once. No worries. Next day, used it for toast again. Blew the gfci in the kitchen. Couldn't reset it because it was fried. Like, melted it. Electrical work now required: $1390 to replace and rewire 12 outlets. Thanks, Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: jcc

customer_reviews.title: While I love the Cuisinart brand
customer_reviews.text: While I love the Cuisinart brand, this toaster oven is so badly engineered that it is cumbersome to use. There is no catch plate on the bottom to clean. The trays need to be juggled to use. There are so many better models on the market. I'm so sorry that I didn't do due diligence on this item. Cumbersome and badly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Clark

customer_reviews.title: Burns everything on the outside, inside not cooked.
customer_reviews.text: I normally like Cuisinart products, but I have to agree with others, this product is VERY defective. I have tried almost everything to keep from burning food on the outside...if a recipe calls for 4oo degrees, I turn it down to 300...if a recipe calls for twenty minutes cooking time, I cook it for ten minutes. Nothing works. This oven seems to just soar up to maximum temperature on every setting. No apparent, accurate or semi-accurate temperature control whatsoever. When you cook homemade pizza rolls, for example, they are burned on the outside and the cheese is literally uncooked in the center.. VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WoW!!! From purchasing October 1st 2018...to taking up space in the landfill by March 1st 2020! The Cuisinart name is evidently no longer associated with being a quality product! What a complete waste of money! When it worked it was amazing to have an air fryer, oven, toaster, etc., all in one product...then without warning it just quit working. My guess is that it got too hot in the upper heating element area and melted some wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Sandal Tan

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I could hardly wait to get this and now after trying to cook with it for a couple months I wish I could send it back. I have eaten more burnt food from this than I have in my 70+ years. I am on a limited income and can not afford to throw food away. I was so sure this was going to help me with cooking only for one. There is definitely a bigger learning curve with this than I can afford.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary N.

customer_reviews.title: Mine failed after 10 months of constant use.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I loved this product, until it died last night. Not even a year old. No idea why product stopped working. And now imaging I can’t return it. 😕 I will replace this item with another, probably not this same one. This inside top surface gets splattered while cooking, wasn’t sure how I was going to throughly clean it. Update: I called Cuisinart cust.serv.# & am delighed to say they are to send me a replacement since I was still in warranty. Glad to not feel as though I wasted $199. on it. I was surprised to know that all Cuisinart ‘s are made in China...just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Jones

customer_reviews.title: Undercooked to burnt in less than 60seconds
customer_reviews.text: The matter of undercooked to burned to a crisp is a matter of a few seconds. It either burns the top or burns the bottom of what's being cooked. Wasted $200 because now I can't return. I haven't had a single thing cook right. I've followed the instructions to a T. I've pulled it away from wall. Everything. Replacing and throwing this out. Don't buy it. I should have listened to the reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Christina M Tanner

customer_reviews.title: runs hot, food burns
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this toaster oven. It was supposed to upgrade my old Cuisinart. My old toaster oven had "exact heat" and it worked very similar to my big kitchen oven. This new TOA-60 is WAY hotter. I try to lower the temperature but then I can't figure out when something is done. I've burned several items, which never burned in my old toaster oven. Thank goodness my old (smaller) toaster oven still works. I still use the old one and only use this new one for air-frying. I wish it had more slots to adjusted the height of the shelf. It seems to be either too low or too high. Really frustrated with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TexasBirdDog

customer_reviews.title: Love the air fryer!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy an air fryer years ago but didn’t want another appliance on the counter. Having a combo like this has been perfect! The oven doesn’t get too hot on the outside (like the Kitchenaid- I returned). I love that it has knobs and isn’t digital. Have only had it a couple of months, but very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Debra DeJong

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality Control.  Conair
customer_reviews.text: It’s a brilliant idea. I was so excited to get my Cruisinart toaster oven air fryer. Aftervvery minimal use the timer knob on the toaster broke off. I requested a new knob, but Conaur refused saying they needed to order a complete replacement. Almost 3 months later I got an entirely new unit. All good excited the old one is still here because the return UPS label doesn’t work. Today while making 2 slices of toast the glass in the door popped and shattered. No apparent reason No way to get a door or a new glass. Now on here it’s two broken expensive units and honestly, I don’t want either of them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Please read !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Normally I only look at positive reviews cause I realize you can't please everyone . I bought this product used it a few times and it was amazing ,but something went wrong very quickly it started running very hot the timer quit working and the only reason I set another timer was to see if I was correct . Thank God I did !! These cookies were placed in the oven for 10 min and luckily I had set another timer cause this could've been bad . Love the brand but this is obviously an issue that needs to be addressed asap
customer_reviews.author: kristen van wingerden

customer_reviews.title: Burns almost everything
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to clean; nice looking. Cons: Analog dials, not digital; temperatures no where near what the dial says...runs very hot; have to turn on timer to turn heat on; no pre-heat feature (no bell when desired temperature is reached). Just poorly engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: After 10 months it has failed
customer_reviews.text: As stated by many other reviewers, the knobs are junk. But that's not the only problem with this piece of junk, the power cord began overheating after the first use. I'm pretty sure 18 gauge lamp cord and plug isn't really the right setup of an 1800 watt appliance. I replaced the cord with a 12 gauge cord and solved that one problem. Now, 10 months later, it will not stay running for more than 10 seconds, and the fan does not stop when the door is opened. If you do decide to buy one of these pieces of junk, buy the extended warranty, you WILL need it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Plug melted after 1 week, won't turn back on.
customer_reviews.text: I had hopes! After 1 week, plug melted on back and it stopped working. Returning through Amazon, Amazon says to contact Manufacturer first to resolve, Cusinart says to return and pay postage and they will call me after it's received to discuss repair. No thanks! Returned to Amazon, no problem. Decided not to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Beeman

customer_reviews.title: Gave it 4 stars. Now it deserves less than one star
customer_reviews.text: In general, I'm pleased with the oven, but find it runs much too hot, and there's no way to calibrate it. The toaster oven I had for years was a Delonghi. It baked everything far better than this one because I could count on it being the correct temperature. Also, when it came to temp, it let me know; something the Cuisinart oven doesn't do. The Delonghi had a clock - a great feature that this Cuisinart is missing. So, although I gave it a 4 star rating, it probably deserves 3.5 instead. I've only had the oven for a month or so, so can't rate durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work good at all. Burns everything
customer_reviews.text: The temperature regulation is the worst. Air fryer burns most everything. Poor temperature regulation. Food is very close to heating elements. If something needs a temp of 350 ̊ set it for 250 ̊ and hope it does not burn. I am very disappointed with Cuisinart TOA-60. I should had bought the Air firer on info merchantial. I wish I could re-gift it back to Cuisinart. Don't buy it. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!  DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: It worked fairly well for 5 months. Now the mode selector knob won’t turn. In order to utilize the warranty I have to find a box, ship it to Arizona (from Michigan) and pay them $10 to ship me a new one. I usually like and find Cuisinart to be good products, but I guess all good things must come to an end. Unless you can afford to replace it within a year I’d suggest looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Okar

customer_reviews.title: Timer is useless.
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day. The reason I only gave it 3 stars is the timer. This is a wind up type timer that you can't be accurate or consistent with. Therefore you have to use your own timer or check through the window often. Why they didn't put a digital timer on this unit is a mystery.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Get something else....
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money we paid for this toaster oven, we dont even do anything crazy with it. Just heating up nuggets and chicken for the kids and toasting. We just passed the 1 year mark and now it decides when it wants to work and when it doesn't. And it most doesn't work anymore. Wont turn on even when you are turning dials. Ridiculous and unacceptable at this price range. My $40 toaster oven I had before it lasted 7 years. Get the Ninja Foodie instead.
customer_reviews.author: kytten74

customer_reviews.title: The basket is hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: This oven air fries my wings, hamburgers, chicken, etc, in a short amount of time. I hate cleaning the basket. You have to use a brush while the basket is under water. Otherwise you will never get the basket clean. Forget parchment paper with holes in them. If you use them, you will have to turn the meat over.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Passaro

customer_reviews.title: BURNS everything!
customer_reviews.text: It burns everything but toast! I have tried setting the temperature to 50 - 100 degrees BELOW what the manual says and it still burns everything. I tried to cook (frozen) fried shrimp and they were burnt 15 minutes before end of cook time - so. . . are they cooked enough for me to eat??? Now it's just an expensive toaster. (Toast comes out OK - set at lightest setting!)
customer_reviews.author: Morrie

customer_reviews.title: Air cooked bacon yum!
customer_reviews.text: Great toast. Great air cooked bacon. Everything tastes better. Works and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: OsoChowlute

customer_reviews.title: Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: When the oven works properly it is great. However, mine has a bad oven timer knob assembly. Cuisinart has no issue standing behind their warranty, but they require the customer pay the return postage. The return postage cost 1/3 the cost of the item. I even asked if I could pay for the return postage using their corporate account to get a better rate and they declined. Buyers be ware. If you purchase this item, best use a local merchant so you can take the defected item back to the store because Cuisinart is too cheap to provide you with a return shipping label.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L Gates

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: Normally Cuisinart sells good products, but they should get out of the toaster oven/air fryer business! Amazon should stop selling this item. For those of you who had this oven work, I think just got lucky or haven’t used it for very long. The temperature dial didn’t work at all, even on the lowest setting, the elements stayed on high. Burned food on the outside, and cold inside. The oven seems like a fire hazard, and we don’t need anymore fires! If you do use this oven, never walk away from it for even 30 seconds! Wish I had read the reviews 1st. Shame on you cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FYI this is a refurbished appliance!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why I docked so many stars is because this appliance is refurbished and never did it say that! The appliance itself is decent. It came looking like new and so far works great. The refurbished ones apparently don’t come with the oil sprayer bottle (not that big of a deal). The biggest issue is that it only has a 90 day manufacturer warranty due to its refurbished status! If I am buying a refurbished item, I should be made aware of that up front!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Briese

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up over time.
customer_reviews.text: This is mainly a review of the service that Cuisinart provides, but it’s worth noting the 2 of the heating elements had stopped working within 6 months, of very light use. While the unit is under warranty, but the Customer Service seems to be from the dark ages: Can’t email any service case information at all Don’t provide a shipping label Do not provide tracking Do not have a drop off location, that avoid return shipping It’s very disappointing and certainly not in keeping with the times.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen appliance I've gotten in years - BE SURE TO PRE-HEAT for air frying
customer_reviews.text: I love air frying but hate pulling out that heavy round air fryer I have. I also use a toaster oven a lot and the old school bread toaster. Now I have something that does all three in one. For bread toaster - finding something that does perfect toast has been tough - this does it perfect. Using it as a classic toaster oven is great - it's big and has two levels. I use this for small quantity instead of turning on the big oven. Air frying is great - now one tip they don't tell you is that you have to PRE-HEAT before air frying. If you don't then it will blacken your food. Love this thing!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JP Vic

customer_reviews.title: Broken knob may cost you $80.
customer_reviews.text: The air fry option is a definate plus. Makes excellent chicken wings & tator tots are crisp without any oil. The reason I gave a one star is one of the knobs broke off. We called the company as there is a 3 year warranty. No knob available however for $10. they would send a new toaster oven. The catch is we needed to ship back our oven. The UPS shipping cost for the return was $70. For our cost of $80. we have a new knob. Terrible warranty!! It's too bad this has ruined our evaluation. The oven really works well. Lesson: be careful with the knobs!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beck

customer_reviews.title: This product is really great.
customer_reviews.text: We just received our air fryer toaster oven and have reheated a homemade pizza and baked a turkey divan. The pizza came out great, heated through and the crust stayed nice and crispy, just the way we love our pizza. The casserole also baked perfectly. Since we make smaller portions these days we hate to turn the oven on for such a small amount of food. The toaster oven is going to work great for our needs, can't wait to try the air fryer, we love chicken wings. It takes up little space on our counter, is really easy to use, so far we are very pleased. My only disappointment was we did not receive the olive oil spray bottle.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat makes useable
customer_reviews.text: I've done measurements and 300 bake convection temp swings between 258 - 352 300 bake temp swings between 252-364 Foods come out burned outside and not done in the middle. Toast comes out lightly toasted on top and hard toasted on the bottom. Air frying wings by the time they get done in the middle outside is getting burned even with temp set way down. I have to pull it out to use because the vent on the back will burn a wall. Disappointed and will be looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Not
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in Feb 2018...air-fryer does not cook evenly, even when you turn the food over. Yesterday this product took a dump. Nothing works on it....at all.
customer_reviews.author: realuser

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, AirFrying Oven.
customer_reviews.text: Great, versatile Oven! Reminds me of the old Ultravection Ovens from about 12 years ago. Solid, nicely designed, with heavy/durable basket and racks. Toaster oven, bake, broil, convection bake, convection broil, air fry. Timer. Door shuts solidly. Air Fryer will cook frozen breaded snacks, French Fries, onion rings, and the like in about 5 minutes straight from the freezer. Come out tasting and looking like deep fried snacks.
customer_reviews.author: GailR

customer_reviews.title: Space saving, but low on features.
customer_reviews.text: This oven attracted me because of the top controls. It uses considerably less countertop real estate than the old one, while still taking in a frozen pizza (yes, I know it is disgusting, but try to tell it to kids). But I expected more functionality from an oven in this price range. Was disappointed to find no pre heat option, where the oven would signal once the temperature has reached the preset value. I also found that it runs hotter than indicated- a prepackaged food would always burn if cooked according to the directions. Well, hotter is better than cooler. Overall I'm still happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for someone with poor vision
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but I give a overall of one!. I am 80 plus and with reading glasses a flash light and magnifying glass the black on stainless text is a pain. Cusinart has a newer model that Amazon does not stock. LED readouts. Cusinart turned a blind eye to my support call and said, WE never heard of a problem! (yea sure!) I am a Amazon customer of many years and hundreds of purchases. This is my first product complaint
customer_reviews.author: P. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Dying after a year
customer_reviews.text: We have had this product since last May and despite the fact we found it difficult to clean, we enjoyed its multifunctional capabilities. However...buyer beware: this month the knobs have begun not to work. Air fry works one day but toast does not, and the next day air fry only works by turning the toast knob. I would say that getting a year out of something that costs this much money is absolutely not worth it. This was a big purchase for our family, so it is a big blow to have to replace it so soon. We certainly will not be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toaster oven because the oven stopped working on my stove. I have had to adapt and find new methods on how to cook certain items. This toaster oven cooks faster than my oven did at a lower temperature. For example my homemade yeast rolls I cook at 310 degrees for12- 13 minutes. (Pics included) I have baked chicken legs and thighs 310 degrees for 50-55 minutes depends upon size. Cakes take about 15-17 minutes. I clean it once a week simple dish detergent and warm water slightly dampen your cloth and like magic it comes right off. I’ve had this toaster oven for a couple of months now and I’m very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K Lowe

customer_reviews.title: I love my Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a travel trailer and if you know anything about trailers you know the propane ovens don't cook evenly and are hard to light. So, we bought this small oven and I love it! It does so many things. Last night I made fried chicken in the air fryer mode. I have also baked a lot in it. It's small, but there are only the two of us, so it's perfect for our meals. It does seem to run a little hot, so I just dial down the temp on recipes and turn the baking rack half way through the timer to ensure even cooking. It's been worth every penny and I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M

customer_reviews.title: Best air fryer toaster convection oven!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, This is my 3rd toaster oven, my first 2 were Wolfgang Puck,the first Puck worked for 3 years, then went Kaput! My second Puck,was a Pressure Oven. What a piece of Junk! Lasted 3 months,Waranty was for 30days!. I have Air fried Pork chops,Fish,Burgers,fries,Mushrooms,onion ring, etc. Baked Casserole,convection cooked scalloped taters and ham, made a small hamlet is the best. I have a Problem with breaded frozen Tenderloins,I will try one thawed next.You must keep an eye on things until you get the hang of it. I burnt a few things,400,and about 10 min. for the norm, then flip, for a few min. on Air fry. Easy to clean, and so convenient.
customer_reviews.author: mikey

customer_reviews.title: Really nice toaster, we got a lemon,
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one from sur la table and it stopped working cold less than one year from purchase. Sur la table only covers for three months and the Cuisinart warranty of three years seems to be mythical. Repeated emails have resulted in zero response. So I bought a second one because my husband quite liked this toaster when it was working. He convinced me that I got a lemon and we should try again. I lost the argument so I purchased again. Will report if this turns into a lemon too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Allen-Attar

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing burns everything in the bake mode. It’s ok as an air fryer but don’t follow the manufacturers directions for temperatures and time or it will burn too. I love my GoWise air fryer & thought this would be a bigger better option with more functions but I feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: D Browning

customer_reviews.title: don't rely on the quick reference airfryer guide!
customer_reviews.text: This air fryer/toaster oven is the BEST! however, you will burn EVERYTHING if you follow the quick reference guide for air frying that comes with it. I've found that reducing the temperature by 50-75 degrees and checking it frequently for cook time adjustments makes everything cook up beautifully. I promise, if you love the taste and texture of fried food and also want to eat healthier, this machine will bring you to sweet, blissful, crunchy food heaven! But it requires a few test runs. Please don't read the one star reviews and pass on this amazing appliance. You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Hydee

customer_reviews.title: Multiple mechanical fails
customer_reviews.text: The original unit that arrived failed after about 5 uses. Just shorted out. Cuisinart customer service was great in replacing it through the warranty. The new one has lasted for a little under 6 months. Now the function dial started to go on the fritz. It takes quite a bit of finagling to get it to work on a bake setting. Most of the others don't work at all. Seeing as I'm going to have to replace it, I'm pretty sure it won't be a repeat purchase. It worked great until it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: unkleaaron

customer_reviews.title: Not working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in February of this year and, aside from constantly burning food because the thermostat is way off, by April we were having issues with the setting knob not working. If you set it to toast it would only work sporadically. Now, 7 months later, the knob is not working at all - it won’t stay on any setting therefore leaving the oven power off and rendering it completely useless. I now have a $200 piece of metal, that has no functionality, sitting on my kitchen counter. The toaster oven I owned before this one was purchased at Kohl’s for $12 and it lasted four years. When I bought this, I didn’t realize I was spending hundreds to downgrade.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: can't quite figured it out yet.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Nesco JetStream oven for decades and lovded it, so I thought this would be an easy upgrade. Not so much. Still trying to figure out how to tweak it to get good results.... Cookies - baking, it burns the outside and the inside is raw Chicken Nuggets - airfrier, doesn't quite cook all the way through. French Fries - same as chicken nuggets I was hoping it would be more intuitive and easy to use, but I haven't gotten the results I wanted to with it yet. Also awkward to use the wire basket - there's not handle so you need to use a hot pad or something to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bongers

customer_reviews.title: Poor temperature control.
customer_reviews.text: 20200821 Cuisinart TOA-60 Convection Toaster Oven Airfryer, Silver This oven replaced a Breville BOV800XL that we purchased in June of 2014. We were disappointed the Cuisinart TOA-60 oven cavity was smaller than the Breville but that was something we could live with. The Cuisinart burned or overcooked food pretty consistently. We were lowering temperatures and shortening cooking times to compensate, adjusting racks and spending more time trying to get it to work than we thought was necessary. The Cuisinart goes back today and we have ordered the Breville BOV900BSS for twice the money and hoping it works a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dowd

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite appliance
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would use this once a month, and I'm using it every single day. As a novelty, I bought some frozen chicken nuggets, and tried the air fryer, and wow! They are so good. I turn the light on inside and can watch them brown up; it seems to happen so quickly, you can SEE them cook. It's amazing. Super tasty. Very clean. A great size. I worried that the counter would get hot underneath, but it hasn't! I'm writing this review from work... and now I wanna go home and cook some more!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Young

customer_reviews.title: The oven is no use at all!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven back in December 2018. I didn't really need it so I kept it in the box until yesterday I've just opened it and try to used it. It is no use at all! Everything got burn! I baked cookies, bread, and meringue were all got burn before the baking time end. The oven becomes garbage now standing in my garage because I can't return it, the time frame for me to do a return is over. I definitely do not recommend this product to everybody. Just buy a professional oven, it cost more expensive but you can use and keep it for long time and you feel satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bake 4 Joy

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably great
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this thing costs less than $400. I bought it thinking it was a bit smaller and was considering returning it was I wanted an air fryer strictly for occasional, very small dishes and because my Phillips air fryer was so stinking loud and smelled up the entire house when cooking ANYTHING. So yes, this is really quiet and gets things crisp- I just toasted some torn bread for croutons and they're perfect and took just a few minutes. Earlier today I air fried the trader joe's spring rolls - one of very few pre-made foods I'll eat- and they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ChocolateMaven

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far we really like this toaster oven, It appears to be well-built compared to other manufacturers. The air fryer option is a large reason why I purchased this particular oven, the air fryer option works great, cooks quickly and the temperature is accurate. The only complaint would be about the general baking setting, the temperature seems to run hotter than what you have it set on. As for toasting it works great it toasts quickly and evenly. For those who have a small kitchen this may not work for you as this unit is pretty large and takes up a fair amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit hot, but is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: When I received this I saw the recommended airfry temperatures. Then I read recipes & they were way lower temperatures. The first time we used it we went with the cuisinart temps, but it burned. We lower the temp a bit and it's awesome (About 50-100 degrees lower) bakes great, makes awesome toast, haven't gotten a crispy pizza crust yet, but we'll keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Boss

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd researched further.
customer_reviews.text: Okay. I haven't even removed the product from the box yet, and as I checked Amazon for user guides and stuff on that page I find all these negative reviews. I do find some good ones too. I chose this oven for two main reason - the Cuisinart name and rep and Amazon's Choice. Now as I read review after review and learn that customer support really sucks. I'm trying to decide whether to keep it or send it back untried. Wish I'd researched further, but, odd thing, most of the negative info was way, way, WAY down the page.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Clean Up a "snap"? Ha Ha Ha
customer_reviews.text: I finally tried the air fryer. Food-wise it's OK although some of the things (like chicken) would have been as good or better in a regular oven. Frozen french fries (Trader Joes). The air fryer recipe calls for 400 degrees for 15 minutes. In an oven, it's 400 degrees for 14 minutes. No advantage at all. Fish is perhaps the best if you want it breaded. Otherwise, use a pan or the oven. Clean up? 12 minutes to cook the fish and 20 minutes (not including soaking first) to get the basket clean. (And yes, I sprayed it first). To me, this is no great shakes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Berman

customer_reviews.title: It's great.
customer_reviews.text: Look, I don't like cleaning so, whatever. Also, the temp knob is clearly too high. I burned something that should not have burned. However, that said, this thing is really awesome and It cooks meat and pizza really well. The air fryer is a wonderful feature that I have wanted for a while and tried to get in other toaster ovens by using a wire mesh rack but this is built-in and works so well. Can't say enough about it. If you need a toaster over, this is the one. (This is the first high-class toaster over I've tried. All prior TOs were cheap Walmart versions.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning...Appliance should have a 3 prong plug !
customer_reviews.text: Appliances that are designed with a metal case, such as a toaster oven, should include a third prong on its plug. This third prong will prevent you from being electrocuted by the metal case in the event that the device malfunctions internally. I read that it is important to ensure all of your small and major appliances that are enclosed in metal, have plugs with three prongs. This toaster oven as a counter-top appliance is HOT and continuously blows our fuses at the box. Never have had any issues or concerns with any other appliance!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cielo

customer_reviews.title: Not calibrated as it should be, and does not live up to the Cuisinart reputation.
customer_reviews.text: As I replied to another user’s comments: This oven bakes way too hot...I have been cooking for 60 years and I reduce the temperature at least 50 degrees and it burns before cooked thru. I am not happy with this product. I have bought many, many Cuisinart products but am really unhappy with this one. I bought it in April so can’t return it, Thought it would just take time and patience, but so far, no. I am certainly not a newbie so do know how to cook and bake but this calibration is way off, and I have had several toaster ovens that cook exactly as they should, even Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: BarbieD

customer_reviews.title: AH.. BASIC CONTROLS.. POWERFUL CONVECTION.
customer_reviews.text: This things looks so pretty.. very spacious!! ANALOG DIALS!! no LED displays with 100 presets that I would never use. NO ANNOYING BEEPS.. A nice calm "ding" bell to tell you when its done and then it shuts off. EXPERIMENT.. YOU MAY BURN THINGS hahaha. Its fast and powerful. there's a learning curve but everything comes out super crispy and fast. NO stay on feature, which is probably for the best. I dont think you would want to leave anything in here unattended. Hope it LASTS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dak Tirque

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this oven, but have been sadly disappointed. First, you must buy special pans because nothing fits in it. Air fryer is ok. Toaster doesn't work well, it goes from barely toasted to burnt in second. The worst part is that the oven burns everything. Every thing. I set the temp lower, I set the timer lower, no matter. Everything burns. It's awful. Cuisinart doesn't care. Not their problem. I will never buy another Cuisinart product.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen r new

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new toaster. Got tired of bread getting stuck in it and burning. I decided to look at toaster ovens and then started to read about air fryers. I was afraid getting one appliance to do it all might be asking too much. So, I was really happy to find out that this machine makes perfect toast and great meals. We've made portobello mushroom fries, shrimp, reheated pizza and several other things which have all turned out great. It's also very easy to clean. It fits on my counter but does take some space. All said and done, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Y. Guare

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the one star reviews and if I had I wouldn't be here right now. There is no way you can use this oven to bake anything - everything burns. Toast came out OK. Tried to bake some chicken - burned after only five minutes. Tried something else - same thing. It's cheaply made, very hard to read or set any of the dials. This is going back. NOTE I recently returned another Cusinart product for the same reason - their convenction bread maker.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Herb

customer_reviews.title: Great oven, not so much an air fryer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try out the air fryer function. I wanted an air fryer for a while and thought I could get a combo oven along with it. The unit itself is nice, but is VERY difficult to keep clean, and sometimes difficult to remove the hot pans and racks when food is ready. The air fryer functional does not work that great. I bought a Ninja air fryer and the food made with that is distinctly different. I kept the Cuisinart because I do use the toaster and oven functions. I don't use this product to air fry though
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Temperature is not even
customer_reviews.text: The size, appearance, and accessories are all great. After reading reviews I have tried to cook several dishes and lowered temperature, but my food continues to be hard and brown at the surface and not cooked well underneath. I just tried baking mini cinnamon rolls and the surface started to get brown and the lower half was still raw. I have used both position 1 and 2 I’m hoping I’ll be able To figure out how to use this without wasting and throwing away more food. The reason was the purchase is to cook my food more evenly than my old oven. Temperature regulation is not even.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TEMP CONTROL IS WAY OFF!
customer_reviews.text: Foods are burned on the outside and under cooked on the inside. This happens whether it is set on bake, air-fly, etc. If you set the temp gauge 75 degrees less than called for, you get better results. Paid much more than other toaster ovens sell for, hoping for a better product. The folks at Amazon were helpful, and suggested we try another electrical outlet, but it didn't make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Davis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap knob and door switch have rendered it useless!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great air fryer and toaster oven, when it worked! BUT the toaster knob broke in less than 100 uses and the door switch now is erratic, sometimes it stays on with an open door or stays off with a close door. Looking for a replacement, and it won't be Cuisinart. By the way this isn't even 2 years old and Cuisinart still has had these issues. Minor components make this useless, look elsewhere. I would have given 1 star, but really great when it works so I gave it 2.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: It burns things well
customer_reviews.text: If you want to do anything more than make toast, don't buy this product. Our oven broke and our landlord won't replace it during the corona virus outbreak. So we tried to go the toaster oven route in the meantime. We've used this product 10-12 times now and nothing we've made has turned out. We've burned everything, despite lowering temperatures 50+ degrees and shortening cook times as much as 50%. If it doesn't burn, it doesn't cook thru due to having to turn the temperature down too low. This thing is going in the trash if I don't throw it out the window first.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on June 22, 2020. I was extremely happy with it until today, August 25, 2020. It is no longer working! Will contact this company to inquire about a new replacement. Will write another review when or if I get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda M Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Works great just watch your food so it doesn’t burn
customer_reviews.text: We use this everyday and it’s great. It’s true that you have to be careful with the heat though so starting out, keep a very close eye on your food until you learn your machine. the good news is that it does cook your food super fast. The air frying plate is kind of a pain to clean id you make something really greasy like bacon...the metal grates completely destroy our sponges, but we started using a brush which works greats To clean the stuck inside cruds (just lots of splashing). Overall, I do recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Alé

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Really like this toaster oven. I have used the air frying, toasting, and baking aspects of it since purchasing. Seems to cook foods well. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that I have had issues with the baking pan warping. It doesn’t do it on air fry, but on baking it has warped inside the oven making it very difficult to slide the pan back out. The pan has scratched the sides of the oven on removal. For future designs, it would be nice if the tray was attached to the door and slid out on opening. Kind of hard to remove items when the pan warps and it is hot. Otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: EmyMountain

customer_reviews.title: Broken temperature control
customer_reviews.text: I tried buying this even after seeing several complaints about temperature issues with this. But unfortunately I have to report that it just does not keep a consistent temperature. Everything I have put in it has burnt in less than half of the time I set it to (and I always set timers to the lower threshold first). I would have liked the large surface area for air frying, but its not worth it if something this large can't do multiple things.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: This thing for any other air fryer or toaster oven to shine. 5yrs ago we bought the Cuisinart pizza stone toaster oven and we loved it but now it is relegated to our outside kitchen. This new one works like a little oven. It has really good convection for using it as a small oven and air fryer is fantastic.I often use it in place of my large oven. It cooks pizza is great and the air frying is even and fast. I like that its turned on with the timer because if you forget it, nothing burns
customer_reviews.author: Weber

customer_reviews.title: Cooks everything perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! No more soggy microwaved food. Bacon wrapped stuffed jalapenos come out perfect. I've used it for sirloin steaks, fish, hashbrowns, shrimp... I've cooked everything I can find and so far it's great. The steaks came out tender and juicy. Especially versatile since it's more than just an air fryer. One tip is the air fryer basket is made of wire and some foods like cheese may get caught. I put the basket in the sink and let it soak overnight and it wipes clean. This thing would be perfect for a deer lease or camping trailer.
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Great product worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Highly recommend the stainless steel air fryer 100% worth the extra money. Previously bought one made of plastic & metal the food had a plasticky taste and the entire house had a weird smell after using it. This product is easy to use and quick to clean up. Works great as both an air fryer and toaster oven. Makes restaurant quality buffalo wings with ease. Only down side would be the size, it is more bulky than a normal toaster oven taking up more counter space. However, you can only fit a limited amount of food on the tray at one time. You will need to cook in several batches when cooking for 2+ people.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy cooking with it
customer_reviews.text: I use the oven several times during the week. I've used all cooking modes. I still use my little toaster for basic toast though. It is doing what I need it to do. I do not have to heat up my whole house in the summer to prepare small meals and that alone has reduced my cooling costs. I haven't experienced any wild temperature variations. It is a good idea to warm it up for a few minutes before adding your food. It made my chicken crispier by doing this. Cleaning it sucks. Oil and grease splatter is not that easy to clean with a simple wet cloth. But overall, I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Budget Mindset

customer_reviews.title: This is the best toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster oven. I originally bought it to get rid of the separate air fryer and then I discovered that it was a very mean job what a pizza. The pizza has a lot more flavor than it did using my Old pizza pizzazz. The air fryer also work very well I mostly do french fries and home fries oh and sometimes chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Broke less than a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Had this oven less than a year. I am a one person household and did not use this a lot. It stopped working less than a year after purchase.. Its during this pandemic so I can't just run to a store to replace it with something else. Ordering another brand online will take weeks. Very dissatisfied!!! I would rate this a zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love the air fryer feature so far. Still getting a hang on the right toaster setting to get the correct level of toasting. Keeping it cleans is a bit of a challenge but might be the case will all air fryer type toaster ovens. The gets grease splatter and even through I clean after each use, it's still getting stained. Also, I didn't realize that tray and racks were not dishwasher safe so if I noticed, I probably would have purchased the model with ones that could go in the dishwasher. Other than the cleaning issues, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice oven.
customer_reviews.text: Nice oven... looks good. But it doesn’t provide a way to pre-heat and see the internal temp without a separately purchased thermometer. And worse, it does not calibrate properly. I have loved Cuisinart products for years. And I have bought all sorts of Cusinart products including a toaster oven years ago that I totally loved. So I’ve been particularly disappointed that I cannot bake anything in this that needs to be properly timed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than 6 months, 90% of it stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the first 6 months! Air fryer was a breeze, baking temperature was a little on the hot side so I adjusted it, toaster part was easy and broiler options was terrific! Then within a few weeks, knobs would turn but the power would not turn on. The only thing that works right now is baking. Literally, no toasting, air frying, broiler, etc. I loved my Breville but wanted to try something new. I’m super disappointed how this broke within 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! To much $ did not last 4 months!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for air fry. Pan that comes with is thin and hard to keep clean. Slide out pan made cleaning crumbs easy. However, Toaster selection did not work after 12 weeks, just stopped!! Last night nothing worked!! So unhappy that I did not take out warrenty but REALLY mad and disappointed that this product lasted less than 4 months!! Would not recommend at all
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this...it breaks in a short time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in January 2018. Within 6 months it broke down and didn’t work anymore. It was dead. I contacted Cuisinart and they sent a replacement and we had to ship back the broken one. (A pain in the butt to do). Less than s year later the 2nd oven also just stopp working. It’s dead too. This one is going in the garbage and we’re purchasing a different brand. Shame on Cuisinart!! I expected more from a so called reputable brand. Will never buy another Cuisinart product again!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: quite  a step up from my old toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: I got this not only as an air fryer, but to replace our old toaster oven. it works so much better all around. Besides being huge, it's just so fast. We have kids so we're constantly cooking things like chicken nuggets and such. We went from near 28 minutes (including warmup time) for a tray of chicken nuggets to about 8 minutes (from a cold oven) in air fry mode. it takes a bit of getting used to to make sure you don't burn things, but it is well worth it, just from a time saving perspective. We've made donuts, grilled veggies, fried chicken, and have even done things like reheated pizza in it. All of it came out great.
customer_reviews.author: TheFilterSaturation

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this machine. Replaced an older model Cuisinart toaster-oven, a New Wave device and a 4 slice toaster. Freeing up much needed counter space. We have tried most of the functions- air fryer, oven, convection oven and toaster. All work extremely well. NOTE- mind the timer for these functions, many times they finish cooking faster than the recommended times. Example- when using oven function for refrigerated Pillsbury rolls on Thanksgiving, only took 8 minutes instead of the 10-12 minutes on package?
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Loved until it stopped working after three months
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this has been one of the best products we have purchased. However, after only three months, The dial stopped working so you cannot select if you want to bake, toast, air fry, etc. , Also, plug looked like it melted. I started to read other reviews and noticed that other people were having the Exact same problem. Super disappointing because it has been something that we use every day and it’s really fantastic when it works;(
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: My favorite toaster oven ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster oven. All features work great and the air fryer mode is terrific. It works great..things like Tator tots cook so quick and come out so nice and crispy. If I only used this for cooking bacon it would still be worth buying. Bacon is so quick and easy and comes out perfect. I liked mine so much I bought one for my mother in law and she loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa L.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Very lightly used, always kept it clean. Broke after 4 months. For $200, expect better.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Gong

product_meta.title: Cuisinart TOA-60 Convection Toaster Oven Airfryer, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:AirFryer Convection Toaster Oven| Color:SilverIntroducing a healthier way to fry, and so much more! The Cuisinart oven fryer is actually a premium full-size toaster oven with a built-in air fryer. That means it not only bakes, broil, and toasts, it also lets you air-fry right inside the oven.
feature_bullets: 1800-Watts with 7 functions: air fry, convection bake, convection broil, bake, broil, Warm, toast
0. 6 cubic foot non-stick interior with oven light. Dimensions (L x W x H): 15. 50 x 16. 00 x 14. 00 inches
Capacity: toast 6 slices of bread, air fry 3lbs of chicken wings, bake a 12-inch pizza or roast a 4 pound chicken
Adjustable thermostat with 60-minute timer/auto shutoff, toast shade selector-timer.UC Cubic Feet: 3.249 lb
Includes: oven rack, baking pan, air fryer rack/basket. Mc cubic feet: 3. 390

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars7,252 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
